metadata.Title: CVE-2019-10098 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
In Apache HTTP server 2.4.0 to 2.4.39, Redirects configured withmod_rewrite that were intended to be self-referential might be fooled byencoded newlines and redirect instead to an unexpected URL within therequest URL.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10098` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.12
apache2-bin - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.12
apache2-data - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.12
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.12
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.12
apache2-utils - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.12
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: apache2 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.18-2ubuntu3.12').
